section.section:
The Maryland College Savings Bond Advisory Board shall make recommendations to:
The Board of Public Works regarding the need for Maryland capital appreciation general obligation bonds to help citizens save for the costs of college; and
In accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, the Governor and General Assembly on the establishment of an incentive program to encourage citizens to purchase capital appreciation general obligation bonds to finance the education of individuals at accredited institutions of postsecondary education in the State.
Each appointed member serves for a term of 3 years and until a successor is appointed.
A member appointed to fill a vacancy in an unexpired term serves only for the remainder of that term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

Each member of the Advisory Board:
Serves without compensation; and
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses in accordance with the Standard State Travel Regulations.
